Another recommendation could be watching "It' s a Wonderful Life". This classic 1946 film, directed by George Lucas, stars James Wilcox as George Bailey, the protagonist of this beloved American film. The movie tells the story of George Bailey who is a small-time businessman at his local bank in Bedford, New York. Despite his best intentions, George is constantly trying to make ends meet and is often plagued with the feeling that he has let down those closest to him. In an attempt to escape from this never-ending cycle of failure and regret, George decides to take a chance on his life by using his lottery ticket to buy a controlling interest in his local bank. As a result of this bold decision to take a chance on his life, George is able to turn his local bank around from being one of the most struggling banks in the country to one of the most profitable banks in the country. As a result of this bold decision to take a chance on his life, George also learns some important lessons about life and the importance of taking risks on your life in order to achieve success and fulfillment in life.

The movie tells the story of Robert McCall who is a former special forces officer now working as a private investigator.
